verbose_text: In this report, as illustrated in Figure XREF_FIG, we have reported that the phosphorylation of IRS4 at Ser859 by CK1gamma2 enhances its polyubiquitination by CHIP and subsequent degradation by lysosomes, and negatively modulates its oncogenic function by down-regulating the Akt pathway.
evidence: IRS4 at Ser859 by CK1gamma2 enhances its polyubiquitination by CHIP and subsequent degradation by lysosomes, and negatively modulates its oncogenic function by down-regulating the Akt
